title: Academic Research Seminar Scheduling & Attendance Optimizer
description: Upload availability and room data CSV files to generate an optimized multi-week seminar schedule that minimizes conflicts and maximizes attendance. Receive conflict alerts and summary scheduling reports.
inputLabel: Upload your CSV files containing availability and room data (multiple files allowed). Optionally, paste JSON data for seminar proposals and faculty availability.
outputLabel: Optimized seminar schedule summary, conflict alerts, and recommendations.
systemPrompt: You are an assistant for academic department administrators planning recurring research seminar series. Accept CSV file uploads or JSON text input describing seminar proposals, faculty and room availability, and preferences. Validate all inputs strictly for format and completeness. Refuse any request containing disallowed or unsafe content. Generate a plain text summary of an optimized seminar schedule minimizing conflicts and maximizing attendance based on the provided data. Report detected conflicts explicitly. Output only plain text unless structured-output mode is enabled. When structured-output is enabled, output a JSON object with keys: optimizedSchedule, conflictAlerts, and summaryReport. Enforce privacy by never exposing personal calendar details. Disallow any content unrelated to academic seminar scheduling. Keep responses professional and concise.

presets.label: Basic Optimization
presets.prompt: Use the uploaded availability and room data to generate an optimized seminar schedule minimizing conflicts and matching room sizes to expected attendance.

presets.label: Conflict Focused
presets.prompt: Analyze the input data to identify and list all scheduling conflicts including overlapping seminars, room double-bookings, and unavailable presenters.

presets.label: Attendance Projection
presets.prompt: Based on historical attendance data and preferences, generate attendance projections and recommend schedule adjustments to improve participation.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output a JSON object with { optimizedSchedule: Seminar[], conflictAlerts: string[], summaryReport: string }.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide your availability, seminar proposals, and room data in CSV or JSON format. If any input is missing or unclear, specify what data you can provide.
finalizePrompt: Confirm you want to generate the optimized seminar schedule and conflict report based on the provided inputs. Reply 'yes' to proceed or specify changes.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Seminar Scheduling & Attendance Optimizer

niche.scenario: Planning and managing recurring research seminar series across multiple research groups within a university department

idea.problem: Department administrators struggle to coordinate seminar schedules that avoid conflicts with research group meetings, faculty availability, room bookings, and attendee preferences, leading to low attendance and inefficient resource use.
inputs: List of preferred seminar dates and times from each research group
Historical attendance records or preferences (if available)
Seminar topics and target audience groups
outputs: Optimized multi-week seminar schedule minimizing conflicts and maximizing expected attendance
Room assignments aligned with expected audience size and equipment needs
Conflict alerts for overlapping events or unavailable resources
Personalized calendar invites and reminders for faculty and attendees
Summary reports on scheduling efficiency and attendance projections
whyItWins: Addresses complex, recurring coordination challenges specific to academic seminar series not tackled by general calendar apps or event planners
Leverages multiple heterogeneous inputs to generate conflict-free, resource-optimized schedules improving attendance and departmental collaboration
Automates tedious manual coordination, saving administrator time and reducing errors
Supports iterative updates and scenario testing, adapting to changing availability or seminar proposals
Can be expanded to integrate with institutional calendar systems and attendance tracking for continuous improvement

upgradePath.today: Provide a single-page app for admins to upload CSVs of availability and room data to generate an optimized seminar schedule and downloadable calendar files
upgradePath.in90Days: Add user accounts, interactive schedule editing, conflict resolution suggestions, and automated email/calendar invite generation
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a multi-page system with integration to institutional calendars (Outlook/Google), attendance tracking dashboards, seminar feedback collection, and AI-driven attendance prediction based on historical data

riskNotes: Requires careful handling of privacy when integrating personal availability calendars
Dependent on accuracy and completeness of input availability data
May face institutional IT integration challenges with calendar systems
Needs to ensure user-friendly UI to accommodate administrators with varying technical skills

blueprint.summary: A multi-page application to help academic department administrators optimize recurring research seminar scheduling by integrating availability, room data, and attendance preferences to generate conflict-free, resource-efficient seminar schedules with personalized invites and reporting.
successMetrics: Reduction in scheduling conflicts and overlaps
Time saved in manual scheduling tasks
User satisfaction and adoption by departmental admins
Accuracy and usefulness of attendance projections and reports

edgeCases: Incomplete or conflicting availability data from multiple sources
Room double-booking due to last-minute changes or data sync delays
User revokes calendar integration permissions causing sync failures
Network or API failures during email or calendar invite dispatch
Simultaneous edits causing schedule version conflicts
Privacy concerns when handling personal calendar data
Handling seminars with multiple presenters or cross-department audiences
Unexpected seminar cancellations or rescheduling after invites sent
nonGoals: Providing a general-purpose calendar or event management system
Handling non-academic or non-seminar event types
Automated attendance tracking via hardware or sensors
Full AI-driven autonomous scheduling without admin oversight

dataFlow: User logs in via /api/auth/login, receives session token and user profile.
Authenticated user accesses Dashboard (/) which fetches seminarScheduleSummary, conflictAlerts, and notifications from /api/schedule/result and /api/notifications/send status.
Admin uploads availability and room data via /upload-data page, sending CSV files or calendar sync tokens to /api/data/upload; server parses and stores data in data-availability and data-room stores.

Admin triggers schedule optimization from /schedule page, sending current seminar proposals, availability, and room data to /api/schedule/optimize; job-optimization runs asynchronously and updates data-seminar with optimized schedules.
Dashboard and schedule pages poll /api/schedule/result to get latest optimized schedules and conflict alerts.
Reports page (/reports) requests report generation via /api/reports/generate, which uses data from data-seminar, data-attendance, and data-feedback to produce reports and exportable files.
Notification dispatch job sends invites and reminders via integration-email and integration-calendar triggered by schedule finalization or scheduled times.
User manages profile, calendar integrations, and preferences on /settings page, updating data-user via secured API endpoints.
Background jobs periodically sync calendar integrations, clean outdated data, and archive old seminar records.
validationRules: Login API: Validate email format and password presence; reject invalid credentials with generic error.
Upload API: Validate file type (CSV) and JSON structure for calendar sync tokens; reject malformed or unsupported data with detailed error messages.
Schedule Optimization API: Validate seminar proposals have required fields (id, title, presenterId, status), availability entries have valid date ranges, and room data includes capacity and name.
Schedule Result API: Ensure user is authenticated; validate response data structure matches Seminar[] and conflict alerts JSON format.
Notifications API: Validate seminarId exists and recipients are valid user emails; reject if seminar not found or recipients invalid.
Reports API: Validate scheduleId exists and user has access rights; reject invalid or unauthorized requests.
User Settings API: Validate email format, preferences JSON schema, and calendar integration tokens for OAuth compliance.
General: Enforce date fields are valid ISO 8601 dates; numeric fields non-negative; JSON fields conform to expected schemas.
Conflict detection: Validate no overlapping seminar times for same room or presenter before schedule finalization.
errorHandling: API endpoints return HTTP status codes: 400 for validation errors with error details, 401 for unauthorized access, 404 for not found resources, 500 for server errors with generic message.
Upload API collects and returns array of errors per file or data chunk to allow partial success reporting.
Schedule optimization job retries on failure with exponential backoff; logs errors with jobId for diagnostics.
Notification dispatch logs failed recipients and retries sending; reports failedRecipients in API response.
Calendar integration errors (OAuth failures, rate limits) trigger user notifications and require re-authentication flows.
Simultaneous edits detected via schedule versioning; API rejects outdated versions with conflict error and suggests refresh.
Privacy-related errors (e.g., revoked calendar permissions) result in disabling sync features and informing user.
UI displays user-friendly error messages and guidance for corrective actions; logs detailed errors server-side.
securityNotes: All API routes except login require authentication via session tokens or JWT.
Sensitive tokens (calendarIntegrationTokens) stored encrypted in data-user store.
Access control enforced: users can only access and modify data related to their department or permissions.
OAuth flows for calendar integrations comply with institutional privacy policies and consent requirements.
Audit logs maintained for data access and changes to support privacy compliance.
Input validation and sanitization prevent injection attacks and malformed data storage.
Rate limiting and monitoring on API endpoints to prevent abuse.
Error messages avoid leaking sensitive information.
Background jobs run with least privilege principle and secure environment variables.
